sentences.en: a rock band with a distinctive sound
All their beds were distinctive; Mac'swas an iron affair with brass knobs.
sentences.cn: 他们的床都各具特色；马克的床是张带球形黄铜柱头的铁家伙。

sentences.en: Beer has a very distinctive smell.
sentences.cn: 啤酒有一种特殊的味道.

sentences.en: Chick peas have a distinctive, delicious and nutty flavour.
sentences.cn: 鹰嘴豆有独特可口的坚果风味。

sentences.en: Cooking with the lid on gives the food that distinctive smoky flavour.
sentences.cn: 盖上盖子做会让这种食物有一种熏制般的独特风味。

sentences.en: Fennel has a very distinctive aniseed flavour.
sentences.cn: 茴香有一种与众不同的茴芹籽的味道。

sentences.en: In order to become famous they must hit upon a distinctive'signature ".
sentences.cn: 要想成名,他们得想出一门与众不同的 “ 签名 ”.

sentences.en: Mid-fifties, short black hair, grey moustache, distinctive Russian accent. Need I go on?
sentences.cn: 五十四五岁，黑色短发，灰色八字胡，明显的俄国口音，还需要我继续说吗？

sentences.en: She has a very distinctive way of walking.
sentences.cn: 她走路的样子与别人很不相同.

sentences.en: The most distinctive criterion for identifying the nature of events is moveout.
sentences.cn: 识别波至本质的最为显著的准则是时差.

sentences.en: The pianist had to tailor his style to suit the vocalist's distinctive voice.
sentences.cn: 钢琴手不得不改变风格以配合歌手独特的嗓音.

sentences.en: This bird has several distinctive features.
sentences.cn: 这个鸟具有几种突出的特征.

sentences.en: This poem has the distinctive flavour of a ballad.
When Miles Davis died, jazz was robbed of its most distinctive voice.
sentences.cn: 随着迈尔斯·戴维斯的去世，爵士乐界失去了其最与众不同的声音。

words.tran_cn: 明显的；独特的；清楚的；有区别的
区别；差别；特性；荣誉、勋章

trans.tran_cn: 独特的，特别的，有特色的
trans.tran_en: having a special quality, character, or appearance that is different and easy to recognize
